milestones: Australian Senate Committee recommends formation of Charities Commission
Dutch parties agree on government formation
Belgian formation talks: King consults incumbent PM
After 9 months, Belgian coalition delivers government
Lebanon forms unity government with Hezbollah-led opposition
ASEAN basketball league moves closer to reality
UN proposes world-wide natural disaster warning system
Gubernatorial candidate Tom Tancredo comments on North Colorado proposal
Hydrogen gas cloud to smash into Milky Way galaxy
Study suggests oldest rocks are from Quebec
Israelis re-elect Netanyahu, centre-left rises
Former UK prime minister Tony Blair converts to Catholicism
Cassini discovers organic material on Saturn moon
Ahern, Blair restate deadline on devolution
Chavez wants UN uprooted from New York
Three new dinosaurs discovered in Australia
Locals claim to have witnessed multiple UFOs over north London
Pope John Paul II meets Iraq's Ambassador
Ezer Weizman former Israeli president dies at the age of 81

duck: Formation flying, aerobatics performed with several aircraft
Formation (American football), a set-up before the snap in American football
Tactical formation, the physical deployment of military forces
Derivation (linguistics), the process of creating new lexemes from other lexemes
formation definition: an act of giving form or shape to something or of taking form.
Offer and acceptance, an analysis of contract formation in law

wiki.text:
'Formation' may refer to:

* Formation flying, aerobatics performed with several aircraft
* Formation (military), a high-level military organization
* Tactical formation, the physical deployment of military forces
wiki.title: formation
